channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: How tech bros bought 'America's most pro-crypto Congress ever'
item.description: Crypto showed up in force this election cycle, raising tens of millions to vote out the industry's critics and vote in its friends.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Small- and mid-caps stole the limelight last week
item.description: Companies less in the spotlight, like Snowflake and Super Micro Company, as well as other small- and mid-caps were contributed to markets' rise last week.

item.title: Southeast Asia salaries set for a 2025 bump, with Singapore lagging the region: Report
item.description: Budgeted salary increases in the region are expected to be higher in 2025 than in 2024, according to a November study by professional services firm Aon.

item.title: 'We can overcome climate change': Richard Branson says young people should not be down about the future
item.description: Sir Richard Branson made the comments as he announced a partnership with the We Are Family Foundation, set up by musician Nile Rodgers after 9/11.

item.title: The world's auto giants will need to partner with Chinese companies to survive in China, analysts say
item.description: Time is running out for traditional foreign automakers to adapt to China's electric car market.

item.title: 'Wicked' soars with $114 million domestic opening, 'Gladiator' snares $55.5 million
item.description: Universal's "Wicked" tallied an estimated $114 million domestic opening and Paramount's "Gladiator II" is set to haul in $55.5 million.

item.title: Data centers powering artificial intelligence could use more electricity than entire cities
item.description: The growing size of data centers is raising questions about power, land and the environment.

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts are bullish on these dividend stocks
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service highlights three dividend-paying stocks, including Exxon Mobil and Walmart.

item.title: In forgotten parts of Singapore's iconic Orchard Road shopping street, a new era is taking shape
item.description: Orchard Road, Singapore's main shopping street, is 2.2 km (1.3 miles) long but much of the activity takes place in the middle of the stretch.

item.title: Germany's 'debt brake' rule helped collapse its government — and it could be about to change
item.description: Fiscal and economic policy differences have been blamed for the German government collapsing, but what role did the country's debt brake play?

item.title: Jim Cramer's big takeaway from the market reaction to Nvidia's earnings beat
item.description: The Investing Club holds its "Morning Meeting" every weekday at 10:20 a.m. ET.

item.title: Bitcoin vs. gold: State Street worries the crypto rally's allure is distracting precious metal investors
item.description: State Street Global Advisors' George Milling-Stanley warns cryptocurrency plays do not offer the stability of gold.

item.title: One of the world's richest families plans to create Paris's next big soccer success
item.description: Antoine Arnault, son of LVMH CEO and Chairman Bernard Arnault, told CNBC the investment in the second-tier club was about "emotions" rather than finances.

item.title: Activist Ananym has a list of suggestions for Henry Schein. How the firm can help improve profits
item.description: Ananym Capital is calling for changes at Henry Schein, which may help the company improve its profitability.

item.title: Donald Trump chooses hedge fund executive Scott Bessent for Treasury secretary
item.description: The founder of Key Square Group was deemed a strong favorite to lead the Treasury Department, along with several other contenders.

item.title: Top 10 S&P 500 stock winners since Election Day
item.description: Policy stances from the incoming Trump administration, bullish quarterly earnings and an "Elon Musk premium" led to lofty stock returns, experts said.

item.title: Why X's new terms of service are driving some users to leave Elon Musk's platform
item.description: Elon Musk's X implemented new terms of service that are driving some users off the microblogging platform.

item.title: Nutritionist from Japan: The food I love eating every day—and that robust 90-year-olds in my life swear by
item.description: "The most lively and robust elders in my life" eat this food, says Japanese nutritionist and longevity expert Michiko Tomioka. It "makes me feel healthier" too.

item.title: Trump hush money sentencing delayed indefinitely
item.description: A New York judge indefinitely postponed President-elect Donald Trump's sentencing in his criminal hush money case.

item.title: Trump might name Kevin Warsh as Treasury chief then Fed chair later, report says
item.description: A former Fed governor himself, Warsh would move over to the central bank after current Chair Jerome Powell's term expires.

item.title: Space vacations and retiring on Mars: SpaceX COO shares 3 visions for the company's future
item.description: Gwynne Shotwell spoke with investor Ron Baron about interstellar travel, competition among space companies and the potential for better tech regulation.

item.title: JaGUar? Luxury automaker defends controversial rebrand amid pivot to EVs
item.description: New logos and promotional videos unveiled by the classic British car brand drew the ire of many on social media this week.

item.title: Apple and Google could face a competition probe over their huge mobile ecosystems in the UK
item.description: The U.K. Competition and Markets Authority's independent inquiry group recommended the watchdog investigates Apple and Google's activities in mobile ecosystems.

item.title: Northvolt CEO resigns as Europe’s big hope for a battery champion files for bankruptcy
item.description: The chief executive of Northvolt stepped down on Friday, shortly after the Swedish battery maker filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the U.S.

item.title: Why the U.S. is growing less food
item.description: Fruit production is down nearly 36% in 2024 from 2003, while vegetable production is down 6.3%, according to the U.S. Department of Agriculture.

item.title: Spain slaps $187 million fine on Ryanair, EasyJet and others for 'abusive' cabin luggage fees
item.description: Spain's Consumer Rights ministry demanded that the five low-cost airlines stop charging additional baggage fees.

item.title: What makes a good leader? Being able to listen, say young people
item.description: Being relatable, having empathy and showing determination are some of the qualities younger generations look for in leaders.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Gautam Adani's U.S. fraud charges could have wider repercussions for India
item.description: U.S. prosecutors allege that Gautam Adani, the second most-wealthy Indian man, personally met with Indian government officials to further their "bribery scheme."

item.title: See some of the best photos from National Geographic's 'Pictures of the Year'
item.description: National Geographic released its annual "Pictures of the Year" issue this week, showcasing 20 photographs that depict striking scenes of nature and wildlife.

item.title: Indonesia wants Apple to sweeten its $100 million proposal as tech giant lobbies for iPhone 16 sales
item.description: The Indonesian government expects Apple to invest more than $100 million into the country if it wants to sell its iPhone 16 in the growing market.
